items.name: General Information
items.subcontent:
The maps here can be used to answer questions such as ...
  • “Is this property in the floodplain?”
  • “What is the zoning for this parcel?”
  • “What is the area of this parcel or these two parcels combined?”
Garrett County Webmaps

This Video shows how the maps can be used.

items.name: Navigation
items.content:
1. Drag to pan
  2. SHIFT + Click to recenter
  3. SHIFT + Drag to zoom in
  4. SHIFT + CTRL + Drag to zoom out
  5. Mouse scroll up to zoom in
  6. Mouse scroll down to zoom out
  7. Use Arrow keys to pan
  8. + key to zoom in one level (using the number keypad)
  9. - key to zoom out one level (using the number keypad)
  10. Double Click to Zoom in
items.subcontent:
Moving between Maps

Click the  Navigation  Widget. Use the pulldown menu and “Launch” button to move between maps while keeping the same extent. See the topics for individual maps for specific navigation information for a particular map. If you launch a new map (or re-launch the current map), the information in the address bar will update. That information consists of the coordinates of the center of the map and the zoom level. If you put your mouse in the address bar (or press ctrl-L), you can copy (ctrl-C) and paste (ctrl-V) a link to a specific location into an e-mail. If you find an error in the data, you may want to e-mail me!

items.name: Basemaps
items.subheader: Background Imagery and other basemap layers
items.content:
Click the Basemaps Widget to select a different basemap. The default map is the Streets Map which is a basic street background. Hybrid maps are the same as the basemap listed above but with labels. The full list is as follows ...
  • Streets
  • Imagery (Garrett Imagery is from October 9, 2011)
  • Imagery with labels (hybrid)
  • Topographic (Terrain)
  • Terrain with labels (hybrid)
  • Oceans
  • Open Street Map
  • MD Imagery from MD iMap (from early 2011)


MD Imagery Basemap

items.name: About the Webmaps
items.subheader: System Requirements and How the maps are made
items.content:
Most of the maps here are made using javascript and the ArcGIS javascript API. One implication of that, is that they require that javascript be enabled in your web browser.

There are two basic types of data displayed in the maps (basemaps and data services). The basemap is underneath the other data showing background reference information which can be imagery, roads, or topography (among other possibilities). The data services included are made from GIS data acquired by the County and turned into services using ArcGIS Server (ESRI Inc.).

The ArcGIS Server software converts the gis data into a format that can be read by the web browser. The ArcGIS javascript API provides a model for writing javascript code to make requests or “queries” from these data services or “REST” services to display data in different ways and interact with the map.

items.name: Bugs and Features
items.subheader: It is not a bug, it is a feature!
items.content:
The maps seem to work well most of the time. Response time ranges from quite snappy to not so great. A lot depends on web traffic on our server and the type of request being made. One thing we have noticed is that zooming in close on an area of interest seems to help. If the map features are not fully drawn, the click to identify (or other) function(s) may not work very well.

The search by parcels and search by road name can take a long time to run and it is difficult to know when it is taking awhile vs. when it is no longer trying. The Geocoder widget (in the upper left portion of the map) usually works better but it requires a specific address to find a specific location. However a generic location can also be specified if you know where you are going (e.g. try searching for Grantsville, MD).

Feature Requests

The webmaps have been developed primarily for Garrett County Employees, but if you have an idea for something you would like to see, let me know via e-mail.

Planned Development

The next map we are working on currently is a subdivision map. The subdivision map will show what the restrictions and requirements are for subdivision of land in different parts of the county.

Releases

New Parcels from the MD Dept. of Planning were added in early December with the addition of “Zoom to Lat Long” and labeled contours added to the Printable Map. There was an update to the Zoning Legend, and thicker Town Boundaries added to the Planning and Zoning Map. This update is version 1.3 (December 19, 2014).

Bug fixes were added to the printable map creating version 1.2 (November 10, 2014).

The addition of the printable map began version 1.1 (October 28, 2014) and it also included the Sensitive Areas Map. This is based on perennial streams, source water protection areas, protected species, and growth areas in the county. These are the types of layers used by the county for our Comprehensive Plan

The first public release was version 1.0 (released circa August 1, 2014).

items.name: PZ Map
items.content:
The Planning and Zoning map was built to answer questions about Zoning in the Deep Creek Lake watershed and municipalities with zoning. When the map starts, Street Centerlines are visible and parcels and addresses become visible when you zoom in. When these layers are clicked, information is returned in a popup window. Some layers (like Parcels) will leave information out if the values are null. Additional Layers (Wind Turbines, Zip Codes, and Election Districts) can be turned on and off that will be added to the map and then those layers will be added to the list of those returning information from a mouse-click.

http://maps.garrettcounty.org/arcgis/pz_map.php

items.name: Layers
items.header: Layers in the Planning and Zoning Map

items.name: Critical Facilities
items.subcontent:
Critical Facilities is a point layer of Parks, Community Buildings, Libraries, Schools, Government Buildings (i.e. Post Offices), Roads and Utilities Facilities, Airports, Nursing Homes, Communications Towers, and Fire & Rescue Stations.
    Types:
  • 1 - Parks   
  • 2L - Libraries   
  • 2S - Schools   
  • 3 - Post Office or Govt. Bldg.  
  • 4 - Water, Sewer, Dump, Recycle  
  • 5 - Police & Criminal Justice   
  • 6 - Roads & Highways Facilities   
  • 6A - Roads & Highways Facilities   
  • 7 - Nursing Homes   
  • 8 - Communications Towers   
  • 9 - Fire & Rescue Facilities

items.name: Wind Turbines
items.subcontent: Wind Turbines is a point layer representing Wind Turbines in the County.

items.name: Addresses
items.subcontent: Addresses is a point layer representing existing 911 addresses in the County. Addresses are created when the building permit process has begun. An address is struck every 10.5 feet with odd numbers on the left and even numbers on the right as the address numbers go up.

items.name: Cell Towers
items.subcontent: Cell Towers is a point layer representing Cell Towers in the County.

items.name: Street Centerlines
items.subcontent: Street Centerlines is a line layer representing Roads and it is based on the center of the road. The roads are categorized by maintenance (State, County, Municipal, and Private) and have address range information. The length shown is for the segment clicked (not the entire road).

items.name: Zip Codes
items.subcontent: Zip Codes is a polygon layer representing Zip Codes and it is displayed as a hollow polygon with a reddish border. It shows the label in the center of the map when turned on and will reveal the code and associated town when the map is clicked.

items.name: Parcels
items.subcontent: Parcels is the Tax Parcel polygon layer.

items.name: Tax Map
items.subcontent: The Tax Map Grid is a regular fishnet grid, breaking the county into cells that are 18,000 feet by 12,000 feet. It can help you find a property if you know the Map and Parcel.

items.name: County Zoning
items.subcontent: The County Zoning Layer is a guide to restrictions to development set for municipalities in the county and for the Deep Creek Lake Watershed. See the Zoning Administration page for more information about zoning in the county.

items.name: Election Districts
items.subcontent: The Election Districts Layer can be used to determine which district a residence is in. This will determine the location and venue for voting for a household. Each Election District is part of a Commissioner District which is also indicated on the clickable map. See the Board of Elections page for more information about Election Districts.

items.name: Town Boundary
items.subcontent: Town Boundary is the political boundary polygon layer for the 9 municipalities in the County.

items.name: County Boundary
items.subcontent: The County Boundary is the political boundary polygon layer for Garrett County.

items.name: FEMA Map
items.content:
• Zone A - Areas subject to inundation by the 1-percent-annual-chance flood event generally determined using approximate methodologies.
  • Zone AE - Areas subject to inundation by the 1-percent-annual-chance flood event determined by detailed methods.
  • 0.2 percent (500-year) Flood Plain
http://maps.garrettcounty.org/arcgis/FEMA_map.php

items.name: Layers
items.header: Layers in the Flood Hazard Map

items.name: Address Points
items.subcontent: Addresses is a point layer representing existing 911 addresses in the County. Addresses are created when the building permit process has begun. An address is struck every 10.5 feet with odd numbers on the left and even numbers on the right as the address numbers go up.

items.name: Street Centerlines
items.subcontent: Street Centerlines is a line layer representing roads in the County. The “Maintenance” field can be one of County, State, Municipal, or Private. There is also a range of addresses stored for each feature. The length shown is for the segment clicked (not the entire road).

items.name: Flood Hazard Areas
items.subcontent: The Flood Hazard Area layer is a polygon layer that defines Flood Hazard Areas of various levels.

items.name: Parcels
items.subcontent: Parcels is the Tax Parcel polygon layer.

items.name: Town Boundary
items.subcontent: Town Boundary is the political boundary polygon layer for the 9 municipalities in the County.

items.name: County Boundary
items.subcontent: The County Boundary is the political boundary polygon layer for Garrett County.

items.name: Measurement Map
items.content:
This map can be used for measuring parcels or any other feature visible in the map. When the map starts, the measurement dialog is open in the upper right section of the map. Click one of the icons. The icon on the left is for measuring area, the middle icon measures length, and the rightmost icon is for getting latitude and longitude. Use the control key (or cmd key on a mac) to snap to parcel features. When measuring area or length, click once to start or continue a line or polygon, and then double-click to end. Street centerlines are visible and parcels and addresses become visible when you zoom in. When these layers are clicked, information is returned in a popup window.

http://maps.garrettcounty.org/arcgis/measure.php

items.name: Sensitive Areas Map
items.subheader: Growth Areas, Protected Species Buffer Zones, and Sourcewater Protection Areas
items.content:
Click to identify addresses, parcels, street centerlines, growth areas, sourcewater protection areas, and buffered areas around protected species.
http://maps.garrettcounty.org/arcgis/sensitive.php

items.name: Layers
items.header: Layers in the Sensitive Areas Map

items.name: Address Points
items.subcontent: Addresses is a point layer representing existing 911 addresses in the County. Addresses are created when the building permit process has begun. An address is struck every 10.5 feet with odd numbers on the left and even numbers on the right as the address numbers go up.

items.name: Perennial Streams
items.subcontent: Perennial streams is a polyline layer symbolized in blue. It represents streams that persist throughout the year as opposed to “intermittant streams” which don$t always have water.

items.name: Street Centerlines
items.subcontent: Street Centerlines is a line layer representing roads in the County. The “Maintenance” field can be one of County, State, Municipal, or Private. There is also a range of addresses stored for each feature. The length shown is for the segment clicked (not the entire road).

items.name: Parcels
items.subcontent: Parcels is the Tax Parcel polygon layer.

items.name: Sourcewater Protection Areas
items.subcontent: Sourcewater Protection Areas (aka Wellhead Protection Areas) is a surface and subsurface area regulated for the purpose of preventing contamination of groundwater such as for a public water supply.

items.name: Deep Creek Lake
items.subcontent: The Deep Creek Lake layer represents the lake boundary.

items.name: Protected Species
items.subcontent: The Protected Species layer is a polygon layer representing a wide buffer around State and Federally Protected (Rare, Threatened, or Endangered) Species. The polygons don't indicate presence or absence of any particular species at any location and are provided as a basic guide for awareness of the potential for presence or absence.

items.name: Growth Areas
items.subcontent: The Growth Areas layer is a polygon layer showing areas where economic development and growth are anticipated in Garrett County.

items.name: Printable Map
items.subheader: Create and print a custom map.
items.content:
Print Parcels, Addresses, Flood Hazard Areas, Protected Areas, and most of the other layers from any of the webmaps. The Printable Map allows a web user to create a PDF or JPG format map with different layers turned on. Additionally the user can draw graphics and add text to the map. Text labels can include coordinates (latitude and longitude) as an option and the Title of the map is customizable.

Here are some steps:

  1. 1. Find the areas of interest on the Planning and Zoning Map (or other map). Explore the Switch Basemap widget to get aerial photography or another preferred background
  2. When you find the area of interest and want to make a map use the Navigation control (Upper Right) and launch the “Printable” map. The Navigation widget launches a new map using your current extent.
  3. On the printable map, turn off layers you arenâ€™t interested in, and set your basemap again (aerial photo or other).
  4. Label points of interest and/or add some graphics.
  5. Give the map a title and click the “Prep Map” button (note the new control added that says “Print”).
  6. From the pulldown arrow next to “Print” select a format (pdf or jpg) and orientation (landscape or portrait) option.
  7. Click the link that just showed up that says “Printout”.
  8. Hopefully if this all ran correctly (sometimes the server fails to create the map), you now have a pdf or jpg image in the browser that you can save and/or print.


The Printable Map

items.name: MD Imagery
items.subcontent: The MD Imagery layer is a basemap created by the Maryland Department of Information Technology from imagery acquired in 2011. The imagery is “leaf-off” and has a resolution of 6 inches. This imagery is not a checkbox on the Printable Map but is available through the “Select Basemaps” widget and is suggested here as a good background layer for that purpose.

items.name: Building Footprints
items.subcontent:
The Building Footprints layer represents buildings on the ground as determined by examination of aerial photography. Currently this layer is only available in the Printable Map.

Image showing Building Footprints and Edge of Pavement features.

items.name: Edge of Pavement
items.subcontent:
The Edge of Pavement Features are a collection of 8 Feature Layers such as Paved and Unpaved Roads, Parking, and Driveways, Runways, and Medians. These are determined by examination of aerial photography. Currently this layer is only available in the Printable Map.

Image showing Building Footprints and Edge of Pavement features.

items.name: Contours
items.subcontent:
The Contours are a collection of 4 Feature Layers representing topography at the 10, 20, 50, and 100 foot contour levels. These are made from LiDAR data collected in 2005. Currently this layer is only available in the Printable Map.

Image showing 100 foot topographic contours.
